title: League of Legends blocked by Library Internet?
body:
I couldn't connect to a league game from draft after picking Azir. It was a black screen with that dialog error.

I later searched for solutions, and found this tunnel proxy thing. 
I tried to follow the link from league page posted by a player (After verifying it), and as expected, this BS came up. 
I then came to a quick, quick, VERY ********* QUICK conclusion that league of legends is blocked due to Peer-to-Peer connections.

(I'm only on this ** internet because of my power being turned off for no reason)
I never knew such an absurd, r%%%%%ed and cancerous act existed, and strongly believe this is infringing on the privacy of the internet.
{{champion:268}} For Shurima! {{item:3072}} {{champion:69}} {{summoner:11}} 

I have tor browser installed and took precautions for r%%%%%ed crap like this. I also saw that even Tor browser was recently blocked (SPECIFI********INGLY) at my school. I could access youtube, etc from college, but not school. R%%%%%ed since they're introducing such a fake representation of "The Real World" to everyone based on their stereotypes. Let's use a quick vocabulary word to summarize this situation. I guess you could say, that was extremely "paradoxical". ************ cu*** ***** ********* ********* *************

Now it's boring. All I could do right now is stare at 3DS Max, Unity and Gamemaker studio. I worked long enough, I need some fun in my life...

I would try browsing with Tor to the tunnel proxy, but... Eh, not worth the wasted time.

replies.body: It's not entirely uncommon for public internet places like internet cafe's and public libraries to block certain types of internet traffic such as online gaming. The main reason is that games like ours can eat up the bandwidth for other users.
